title: Sheffield United vs Liverpool, Premier League: What time is kick-off , what TV channel is it on and what is our prediction?
text:
Mohammed Salah has started the season in fine form scoring four goals in six Premier League appereances - REUTERS

What is it?

Sheffield United take on league leaders Liverpool in both sides' seventh match of the Premier League season.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

When is it?

Saturday 28 September at Bramall Lane.

What time is kick-off?

The game kicks off at 12:30pm BST.

What TV channel is it on?

The match is live on BT Sport. Alternatively, follow along with live updates from Telegraph Sport.

What is the team news?

Sheffield United

Striker Billy Sharp is suspended and will miss the match while David McGoldrick is an injury doubt and will be assessed ahead of kick off.

Liverpool

Sadio Mane is expected to be fit to play despite picking up a minor thigh injury. Divock Origi's fitness will be assessed closer to kick off while Allison Becker and Xherdan Shaqiri are still unavailable.

What are they saying?

Sheffield United coach Chris Wilder:

"I don't want our players to look at them all starry-eyed.

"Of course, playing the best team in Europe at Bramall Lane was always going to be one of the fixtures to look forward to when we got promoted back to the Premier League.

"It's a reward for the supporters, who have stuck with us through thick and thin, and the challenge for us now is to make sure this becomes a regular fixture in the Premier League.

"But I don't want the players speaking to their players before and, 'can I swap shirts and any chance of signing this?'. And they won't.

"We are playing them on a level playing field in the Premier League and we deserve to be here. Of course there's enormous gaps between the both clubs at the moment and we're trying to make that gap a little bit closer.

"I don't want Liverpool to come here into our backyard and go, 'well, thanks very much that's the easiest three points we've picked up all season'. If they do win, I want it to be over our dead bodies."

Liverpool coach Jürgen Klopp:

Story continues

On Chris Wilder: "It's incredible what he is doing. We are still analysing them and they are really interesting. Aggressive, good pressing when they have the ball are interesting patterns with overlapping CBs. Four years in England I don't know all the clubs but they are big."

"Both Origi and Mane trained yesterday, No issues. Alisson is in a good way. Not with us but a full session. He is getting closer and closer. Ali is not in contention for tomorrow. It looks like he can train with the team from Sunday."

"We are considered as a top team, we don't want to behave like one. The only advantage they have is their stadium, it is not allowed they fight more, run more. We go there for the first time and I am really looking forward to it."

What are the odds?

Sheffield United to win: 7/1

Liverpool to win: 1/3

Draw: 19/5

What's our prediction?

Sheffield United have had a solid start to the season and will be looking to make home advantage count. However, Liverpool's run of winning Premier League games looks set to continue as their attack has too much quality for the home side.

Sheffield United 1 Liverpool 3
description: Sheffield United take on league leaders Liverpool in both sides' seventh match of the Premier League season.
